title: Time Calculations
description: Practice calculating elapsed time with real-world scenarios

questions.question: Sarah starts reading a book at 3:20 p.m. She reads for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Then, she takes a 20-minute nap. What time does she wake up from her nap?
Mike begins cooking dinner at 6:10 p.m. The cooking takes 1 hour and 20 minutes. Then, he spends 15 minutes setting the table. What time does he finish setting the table?
Emma starts her piano practice at 4:45 p.m. She practices for 50 minutes and takes a 10-minute break. What time does she finish her practice?
David starts his morning run at 7:00 a.m. He runs for 30 minutes and then spends 15 minutes stretching. What time does he finish stretching?
Lisa starts her art class at 2:15 p.m. The class lasts for 2 hours and 30 minutes. Then, she stays for an additional 25 minutes to clean up. What time does she finish cleaning up?
Tom begins studying at 8:25 a.m. He studies for 2 hours and 40 minutes, then takes a 30-minute lunch break. What time does he finish his lunch break?
Rachel starts her yoga session at 9:30 a.m. The session lasts for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Afterward, she meditates for 20 minutes. What time does she finish meditating?
James starts watching a movie at 7:20 p.m. The movie is 2 hours and 35 minutes long. Then, he spends 10 minutes discussing it with friends. What time does he finish the discussion?
